page.title: 11Caldewell Mill.
page.content: The mill has an over splash wheel i.e. the water came in over the top and as such it was more efficient. There is no constant water supply but it was fed by the mill pound at Caldewell. The pound was dug specially for this purpose and it would fill up during the night and in the morning a lever was pulled in the mill to open the sluices to let it run over the wheel.It used to grind corn and pig grist. The mill was shut down when the council drained the land up by the Plough and Harrow pub then cutting off adequate supply to the pound except in times of flood.
